alert.note: Alert for Norfolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 10:57PM EDT until September 14 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of Massachusetts, including the following counties, Bristol, Norfolk and Worcester. Portions of northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, Bristol, Kent and Providence. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Woonsocket, Cumberland, North Providence, Franklin, Johnston, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Mansfield, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Norton, Foxborough, Bellingham and Barrington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
